title: Quiz 7: Community Health Nursing - June 2018 FQE
description: Complete Final Qualifying Examination from June 2018 covering Teamwork, Vaccines, Management, and Communicable Diseases.

questions.question: One of the following is a characteristic of a good team:

options.text: Every member has all the required skills, knowledge, or role that contributes to the work of the team
The members regards themselves as a group of competing team
The team member cannot cope with the various personalities and relationships in the team
The members regard themselves as one and not as a group of individuals

questions.explanation: Cohesion and a shared identity ('we' instead of 'I') are hallmarks of a good team.

questions.question: Controlling is a managerial function which involves:

options.text: Reducing cost and directing efforts towards desired results
Measuring and correcting the performance of employee
Contributing to purposeful organization of work

questions.explanation: Controlling involves monitoring performance against standards and taking corrective action.

questions.question: The following vaccines are stored at -15 degrees and -25 degrees at the National level:
questions.explanation: Heat-sensitive vaccines (OPV, YF, Measles) are kept frozen at national/regional stores.

questions.question: One of the 'Reaching every district' (RED) strategies is:

options.text: Opening up new service delivery points

questions.explanation: Reaching the target population involves re-establishing outreach and opening new static sites.

questions.question: BCG vaccine requirement for a health centre inclusive of wastage whose target population is 1500 children per year is approximately:
questions.explanation: Calculation using 1.5 wastage factor: 1500 * 1.5 = 2250 doses.

questions.question: The first step in the procurement cycle is:

options.text: Awarding purchase order to the vendor
Identifying the items to be procure

questions.explanation: The cycle begins with Needs Assessment (identifying items) before requisition.

questions.question: The following factors contribute to successful partnership and collaboration:
questions.explanation: Trust, communication, and leadership are foundational for partnerships.

questions.question: The number of new cases in a specific population within a defined time interval is:
questions.explanation: Incidence refers to new cases.

questions.question: Community inventory taking provides information on:

options.text: Total population as per census, health facilities
Total population as per census, marital status

questions.explanation: Community inventory gathers detailed demographic and socio-economic data.

questions.question: Disability friendly physical facility means the premises:
questions.explanation: Accessibility (ramps, wide doors) makes a facility disability-friendly.

questions.question: Incubation period of shigellosis is usually:
questions.explanation: Shigellosis has a short incubation period of 1-4 days.

questions.question: The spread of hepatitis A can be reduced by:

options.text: Proper disposal of sewage waste within communities
Draining all stagnant water in the fields
Vaccination of all stray and domestic animals

questions.explanation: Hep A is fecal-oral; proper sewage disposal breaks transmission.

questions.question: Random sampling methods used in community diagnosis include:

options.text: Stratified sampling, quota sampling, snowball sampling
Simple random sampling, cluster sampling, purposive
Cluster sampling, systemic sampling, stratified sampling
Snowball sampling, simple random sampling, stratified sampling

questions.explanation: Cluster, Systematic, and Stratified are probability (random) sampling methods.

questions.question: The first three steps of community diagnosis include:

options.text: Planning the survey, developing and pretesting the survey tools, execution of the survey
Exploration, planning the survey, execution of survey
Planning the survey, execution of survey, data analysis
Planning the survey, exploration, developing and pretesting survey tools

questions.explanation: Exploration -> Planning -> Execution.

questions.question: The following are water borne diseases:
questions.explanation: Hep A, Amoebiasis, and Polio are transmitted via the fecal-oral route (water/food).

questions.question: Match the causative organism with the corresponding disease:
questions.explanation: Rat Flea -> Plague; Wuchereria -> Filariasis.

questions.question: Select the TRUE statements regarding HIV:

options.text: Human immunodeficiency virus can be transmitted during the window stage
Acquired immunodeficiency syndrome can be prevented through intensive health education

questions.explanation: HIV is transmissible in the window period. Education promotes preventive behavior.

questions.question: Menopause is a stage in life:

options.text: When menstration does not occur any more
When ovulation and reproductive capacity ceases
When grey hair appears and hair line recedes

questions.explanation: Menopause is the biological cessation of ovarian function and reproductive capacity.

questions.question: The mechanism of action of contraceptive implants is:

options.text: Thickening of cervical mucus, suppressing ovulation, thinning of the endometrium
Thinning of cervical mucus, suppressing ovulation, thinning of endometrium
Thickening of cervical mucus, suppressing ovulation, thickening of endometrium
Suppressing the endometrium, encouraging ovulation, thickening cervical mucus

questions.explanation: Implants thicken mucus, suppress ovulation, and thin the lining.

questions.question: Which of the following is true about natural family planning:

options.text: Women with irregular menstrual cycle can use
All clients of reproductive age can use
Women with regular /established menstrual cycles can use

questions.explanation: Natural methods require regular cycles to predict fertility accurately.

questions.question: Identify barriers that hinder counseling in family planning: (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: Barriers include privacy, language, bias, beliefs, and time constraints.

questions.question: Roles of a nurse in implementing SDG 3 (Good Health) for women include: (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: Nurses promote maternal health, FP, screening, and rights.

questions.question: A 14-week-old baby (Sue) comes for the first time (missed birth/6wk/10wk vaccines). Which vaccines should be administered NOW? (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: Start with the first dose of all missed antigens suitable for age. Do not jump to dose 3. Measles is for 9 months.

questions.question: Roles of the county public health nurse include: (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: CPHN manages nursing services at the county level (planning, supervision, surveillance).

questions.question: Components of a school health program include: (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: School health includes education, services, and environment.

questions.question: Benefits of community participation in health programs include: (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: Participation leads to sustainability, resources, appropriateness, and empowerment.

questions.question: Sources of government revenue include: (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: Revenue comes from taxes, fees, fines, grants, and loans.

questions.question: Arrange the stages of Cholera progression:
questions.explanation: Cholera progresses from Evacuation -> Collapse -> Recovery.

questions.question: Factors to consider when choosing an officer to delegate a task to: (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: Delegation should be based on competence, workload, attitude, and experience.
